intro: Dilatris paniculata, commonly known as the panicled dilatris, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. Dilatris paniculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive floral display.
